subject: Cybersecurity
title: SolarWinds: The Supply Chain Nightmare
description: A 60-second lesson on SolarWinds: The Supply Chain Nightmare.

hook.text: Russian hackers hid inside a trusted software update and infiltrated 18,000 organizations, including the Pentagon.

buildup.text: In 2020, attackers compromised SolarWinds' build process. Every customer who updated got the backdoor too.

discovery.text: The malware sat dormant for weeks, then activated. It evaded detection for 9 months before FireEye found it.

twist.text: The victims trusted the update because it came from their own security vendor â€” the trust itself was the weapon.

climax.text: SolarWinds proved that the software supply chain is the weakest link in modern cybersecurity.

punchline.text: The safest update you installed was the most dangerous.

quiz.question: How did the SolarWinds attackers deliver their malware?
